CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 6, 1967, pg. 1 reads: "Wallace Incident, Prompt action by Police prevented two identified men from entering the 17th floor Ballroom of the Penn-Sheraton Hotel during the appearance of George c. Wallace, guest speaker at eh Amen Corner Dinner. Tight Police security was clamped around and in hotel, but these two men slipped through.  They were quietly escorted from the hotel.  Another incident involved New Courier photographer Teenie Harris, whose camera was nearly knocked from his has hand by an Amen Corner member.  Harris was attempting to take pictures of Wallace and Marshall, president of the club. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh police officer speaking to man outside of the Fort Duquesne Room, during the visit of Ex- Alabama Governor George Wallace, Penn Sheraton Hotel
